topic.title: Too many open files in UiServer.py line 76
topic.body:
I get this error sometimes.. Does anyone know if it's a bug?

Server error

Err: OSError: [Errno 24] Too many open files in UiServer.py line 76 > UiRequest.py line 80 > UiRequestPlugin.py line 21 > UiRequest.py line 328 > posixpath.py line 364

1_1A6hcWNpQ9SSLoTTpuT19VsVQ6WCVRkyen.body:
> [mtsvip](#comment_3_17tRugXJrS18zKWVEYqZCPisSTk43hqUzx): What's the link to ZeroMail?

Found it. http://127.0.0.1:43110/Mail.ZeroNetwork.bit

> [pyschopomp](#comment_7_1D7uESYtAKV36MVPGJZXuE7LUKbLwfo4dX): A few questions regarding this:Is this the intended behaviour for ZeroMail in particular?Are users expected to backup their messages elsewhere in the event of the other party deleting the message form their end?If any of the above is true, what is the thought behind it? or is this an unintended side effect of ZeroNet's default behaviour?
> Cheers

No, if this is happening it's an unexpected behavior and a bug that needs to be worked on. Each owner has a key and proof of ownership of the data, if you delete something not yours it should be re-uploaded back to you because you are not the owner. You can remove only your files...

I think, when you receive an email you become an owner of it and only you can delete your emails from your inbox.. And you are the owner of your emails in Sent folder. Same goes for the receiver, he owns the email that was sent to him that he now has in his inbox.

1_1NZzwF41g4xAn2R6t8UC625wEDfQtQdB1B.body: It was discussed here last night. Zero net doesn't support it it, but you can use https://webtorrent.io https://instant.io as alternative for now.

3_15ymkjUYJS6tjUC35AekGMExZMN6iks8ma.body:
brew install tor
then run tor in a second window. 

Edit config to enable controll protocol:
mcedit /etc/tor/torrc
Remove the # character from lines ControlPort 9051 and CookieAuthentication 1 (line ~57)

> [theta](#comment_10_15ymkjUYJS6tjUC35AekGMExZMN6iks8ma): Now when I "log in" to ZeroNet, it says "PORT: CLOSED"  and "TOR: ALWAYS" in my top-right corner of the screen. So I guess it works.
> THANK YOU VERY MUCH! :D

Great you got Tor working. Now open the port on your router if you want. If it's a UPNP supported router, it should have opened it automatically. I had to open it manually on my Apple Airport Extreme router.

1_1Ao1FGCWvNNwf4Y4KMKJp9HgPbseU7gE31.body: Do you mean Tor? VoIP should work over tor yes.

1_1D7uESYtAKV36MVPGJZXuE7LUKbLwfo4dX.body:
We'll have to test more. But I really don't think we can remove data in someone else's Inbox and Sent folders.. They become the owners... 

My reply to another thread:
"I think, when you receive an email you become an owner of it and only you can delete your emails from your inbox.. And you are the owner of your emails in Sent folder. Same goes for the receiver, he owns the email that was sent to him that he now has in his inbox."

> [pyschopomp](#comment_11_1D7uESYtAKV36MVPGJZXuE7LUKbLwfo4dX): nofish replied in the other thread and said users don't receive a copy, they read the message from file's sender. Which brings us back to question how resilient data in ZeroNet actually is.

yes, correct. file is technically just duplicated locally. and all users sync it. only those who it was directed to will see it in their inbox folder.

The data should be resilient. For example this Zerotalk forum where we speak now. If you delete files that you don't own, I think it will be recreated in your file system. At least this is the design I would expect.
All these conversations should help a lot the developers of Zeronet. We are raising great questions here.

> [superlugia](#comment_9_1AFL4FFT3BuEDwTwVqychMq4LbxjuEY5Ss): But wouldn't the person who received the copy of the data actually have to personally delete it. I think all that would happen is that the person would stop receiving updates.

If he deletes the data that's not his, he risks breaking the integrity of the structure on his machine only. He will need to re-sync the whole thing to restore the functionality, IMO. For everyone else it will keep working and syncing fine...

> [pyschopomp](#comment_15_1D7uESYtAKV36MVPGJZXuE7LUKbLwfo4dX): So in the end it is up to the users to backup any data they obtained through ZeroNet. That's fair enough but it should be on the tin so users are aware that they should backup any data they don't want to be modified.Also a mechanism to do this through the interface would be nice, along with a notification that a new version of the data will be pushed.

Not sure about that. It's up to user to backup his data only. No need to backup anyone else's really. If you loose your machine, everything will be restored back to your machine except your data I assume. In some cases I assume even your data will be restored back to your machine but you won't have proof of ownership anymore.

11_1MxdAjWgnqwCaunGHmhY39tVR51qV3peJL.body: Not sure why even create a document on google when you can create a page on Zeronet :) Both to support and explore the technology...

1_1JxycrsLzVrPA247VxtPuwfdQBA6BJrSQ3.body: It's a great topic and a very big one. Might require a new category or forums website :) not just one question and answer. There are many things going on in the world and like snowkeld said media is doing a great job misinforming the public about the real things. Let's hope this platform here keeps increasing popularity and the code gets better, then we can have wider conversations.

1_154jAWx5PDRmvF4txGHo4Edw1BpduhDyvw.body: yes, there are proxies and yes, it can sometimes be convenient, but it defeats the purpose and breaks the "decentralization" idea of it. if the proxy server goes down you are SOL. But hosting the code on your own machine and using http://127.0.0.1:43110 is the best way to go.

3_17tRugXJrS18zKWVEYqZCPisSTk43hqUzx.body: Close, but in my case, my Mac never went to sleep. It's just randomly starts throwing errors. Thanks anyways! I'll keep researching.

Looks like still the same fix as in that issue 320.

$ python test_max.py 
Max open files without changing settings: 253
Current RLIMIT_NOFILE limit: 256 9223372036854775807 Changing to 3000...
Max open files after changing settings: 2997

Thanks!

> [nofish](#comment_438_1J3rJ8ecnwH2EPYa6MrgZttBNc61ACFiCj): Fixed in latest version (rev948), please update!After restart you can verify if its working by searching for Current RLIMIT_NOFILE: in log/debug.log (it's right after web interface address displaying)

Thank you!
Updated to latest version. Love the one-click update process! Great job!

1_18SV5U2zbB3EjxYCBTQzwakTKRjf81AfPQ.body: Correct. Looks like the site is back, but always keep in mind that it's a backup option in case you don't have a way to run a localhost. Proxy sites are great and they support the community etc but not as a primary source. So don't rush getting used to them.
And actually site is up, but need to specify a port as well. http://zerobit.io:43110/1HeLLo4uzjaLetFx6NH3PMwFP3qbRbTf3D

2_1Hcc6FX8CaRnXcGC4EYZ4NjrR2yfxuUHW8.body: It's not like netflix or hulu. Play site is just a collection of torrent links.

1_1KRDb5SVJe8Gjy9eYEQz62tJv73vavZdUn.body: probably not too hard. everything is possible. it will come some day.

1_18jipjDsfAxAuq4ixbi2w24xJrYVfTYFPn.body: There is no better place than 127.0.0.1.
